intro: Lachnostoma bricenoi, commonly known as the Briceno's lichen, is a member of the Lachnostomataceae family. It is a crustose lichen that typically grows on rock surfaces in arid or semi-arid environments. The thallus is leathery and dark in color, with a distinct, uneven surface. It is characterized by its unique chemical composition, including the presence of specific pigments and secondary metabolites. This lichen is of interest to mycologists due to its ecological adaptations and potential medicinal properties.
